text: i'm john harwood with the new york times
in CNBC it's fitting that we're joined
here at the democratic convention by the
author of born fighting and a time to
fight two different books US Senator Jim
Webb of Virginia senator thanks for
joining us one of the themes of this
Democratic convention is the Democrats
are going to fight more aggressively
than has been the case in some past
elections some Democrats think John
Kerry made a mistake of his convention
in not strongly enough contesting george
w bush what's the right way to fight
john mccain when he says that barack
obama is a paris hilton like celebrity
who's not ready to lead and when he says
he's going to raise taxes direct the
economy well if you look at the karl
rove formula and I had it used against
me two years ago and recently the McCain
campaign brought all the car will people
in from all other than rope himself it
is very simple it is this person is not
like you this person does not understand
you this person cannot be trusted and so
that is really the mantra and they have
to push back in the same way it becomes
not so much this issue or that issue but
basically what is the person what does
the makeup what the person is running
for president is he going to really
understand you or not well so you know
John McCain very well you've known him
for decades he's been a friend of mine
for 30 years so is the right way to go
back with a character attack on John
McCain no I I think that you know first
of all everyone as enormous respect for
John McCain's service to our country and
everyone pretty well knows john mccain
in terms of his personality you know
he's a combative guy can be very funny
it can be very mean and i think the
world as a friend i think what they
basically need to do is to say this
person is not like you in terms of where
the country is right now this person
doesn't understand where the country
needs to go and you need somebody else
to trust in terms of bringing to change
it
let's go about we don't have to get down
in the gutter runs given the tightening
in the polls that we've seen in the last
couple of weeks do you think that the
McCain attacks the celebrity the Paris
Hilton the gas tax and some of the
economic attacks are they working well
the those type of attacks inevitably
have at least a short-term impact and
you have to be able to address them and
I think what the obama-biden campaign
needs to do is get on the message that
served the Democratic Party so well all
the way in to say the late 1970s but
remember last time that a democratic
candidate won a majority of the votes in
the united states with 1976 they got
away from the message of taking care of
working people and message became very
confused with all of these other
interest groups that came into the
democratic party and all of those
interest groups deserves some attention
but Joe Biden's history really when I
look at him is taking care of working
people and we need to get back on that
message show that they have the answers
that people can trust moving into the
future you were talked about as a vice
presidential candidate for some of the
same reasons we've been discussing the
need a hit back took yourself out of
contention what do you want to see Joe
Biden do now that Barack Obama has
selected him well I I do Joe Biden as
something of a rudder you know a ship as
a sailor none has a rudder he's got
years of experience he's not trapped by
the experience and people well I think
we'll be reassured by the fact that not
only in the campaign but in the
governing cycle Joe Biden will know how
to work with the Congress he's been down
these roads so many times and for me
personally he's got porn a religious
experience and also to be personally
someone who puts working people at the
top and that's what the Democratic Party
City tougher to carry your state of
Virginia now that neither you nor
governor Kaine has been added to the
Democratic ticket I think Virginia is
very much in play if you look at the new
border registrations that took place in
the primaries Hillary Clinton and Barack
Obama both got more votes than John
McCain did and it's not a totally fair
comparison because there's was more a
more contested race but with the with
the
new voters that have come in and with
Barack Obama working very hard in south
central and south side of Virginia which
was both areas hit very hard by
outsourcing and the loss of
manufacturing jobs and these sorts of
things I think Virginia has as a real
chance to go to be the determining state
for sure let me ask you one more
question about Iraq which we at one
point the campaign thought was going to
be the dominant issue the search has
seemed to reduce levels of violence
reduced somewhat the level of anxiety
that Americans have had about our troops
being there though they're obviously
tired of the conflict how do you think
the swing voters some of those
working-class voters that both sides are
targeting how are they processing this
change in the situation in Iraq what
role is that issue going to plan well I
don't I don't think that the situation
in Iraq and the situation with respect
international terrorism has been
properly articulated by either side
right now and say that personally it's
not simply that the surge has worked
which everyone says it is that the
forces of international terrorism on
mobile they don't recognize one national
bound bound reor another they weren't
there when we first got there we got
bogged down in Iraq and they pretty much
relocated back to their center of
gravity over in Pakistan Afghani order
we need a sensible policy that relates
to international terrorism that isn't
simply sending more troops in
Afghanistan it's let's get an
articulated policy a strategy that has
an endpoint which we did not do in Iraq
and which we're in danger of not doing
in Afghanistan so I think that issue if
you combine terrorism with with Iraq
it's still very high on people's radar
screen we need to hear about that we
need to hear sensible policies with
respect to our future in terms of energy
that's a national security issue that's
ranks right up there in the top two or
three national
issues and from from both candidates we
need to hear more than slogans on that a
lot of Democrats have expressed concern
that barack obama hasn't dominated the
issue of the economy as well as he might
given what the polls show and given the
opportunity for Democrats out there what
does he need to do differently on the
economy I think that my personal view is
that the debates are going to really
clarify the intellectual level the level
of understanding and the desire for the
right kind of changes in the future
people are going to be able to see
Barack and John McCain on those issues
and on site again I think both of these
candidates if I had 11 hoped it would be
we would we would get them to articulate
clearly their sense of a future in terms
of energy policies comprehensive energy
policy which is something I'm going to
be working on very hard over the next
year how concerned are you that Barack
Obama for whatever reason is not going
to be able to connect with those working
class voters that you've written about
that you come from their key to this
election I think he is really making
good strides you know he's been down in
Southwest Virginia right after the
primaries were over he was in south
central and south side I was with him in
Lynchburg we had a great rally in
Lynchburg with 2200 people packed in a
high school auditorium right across from
the Jerry Falwell airport so he's a big
part of it down there showing up and
then it's the same thing I am like you
in terms of where I could see the other
issues are I I do understand where we
need to go when you can trust me to
bring this country in the right place in
the future that's got to be his mentor
senator thanks so much for joining going
to be with you i'm john harwood chief
Washington correspondent for CNBC
